questions.fact: The base currency indicates the currency in which the fund's value is calculated.

questions.question: In which country is the fund domiciled?
questions.fact: The domicile of a fund affects its regulatory environment and tax implications.

questions.question: What is the fund structure of the UK Value Opportunities Fund?
questions.fact: UCITS funds are a popular European investment vehicle due to their regulatory standards.

questions.question: Which sector has the highest exposure in the fund?
questions.fact: Materials sector exposure in the fund is 15.4%.

questions.question: What is the total number of positions in the fund?
questions.fact: The fund holds 52 positions, indicating the number of different investments it holds.

questions.question: What percentage of the fund's assets are invested in large cap companies?
questions.fact: Large cap companies represent 33.0% of the fund's market capitalization exposure.

questions.question: Who is one of the fund managers of the UK Value Opportunities Fund?
questions.fact: George Godber has managed the fund since 2017 and has 23 years of industry experience.

questions.question: What is the ongoing charges figure (OCF) for the GBP I Acc share class?
questions.fact: The OCF represents the annual charges taken from the fund, impacting investor returns.

questions.question: What is the performance fee for the fund?
questions.fact: The performance fee is 10% of outperformance of the FTSE-All Share Index.

questions.question: Which company is the largest position in the fund?
questions.fact: Morgan Sindall Group represents 3.7% of the fund's total positions.

questions.question: What is the historic yield based on a NAV per share of £13.30?
questions.fact: Historic yield is a measure of dividend return and not an indicator of total performance.

questions.question: What percentage of the fund is invested in cash?
questions.fact: Cash holdings in a fund can provide liquidity and reduce volatility.

questions.question: What is the active share percentage of the fund?
questions.fact: Active share measures how much a fund's portfolio differs from its benchmark index.

questions.question: The fund's NAV per share is £____.
questions.fact: NAV per share is a measure of the fund's value per share.

questions.question: The investment manager of the fund is ____.
questions.fact: Polar Capital LLP manages the fund, ensuring compliance and seeking optimal returns.

questions.question: The fund is classified as Article ____ under the EU Sustainable Finance Disclosure Regulation.
questions.fact: Article 8 funds promote environmental or social characteristics.

questions.question: The benchmark index used by the fund is the ____.
questions.fact: The benchmark helps track fund performance against a representative market index.

questions.question: The fund's launch date was ____.
questions.fact: The launch date marks when the fund was made available to investors.

questions.question: The sector with the lowest exposure in the fund is ____.
questions.fact: Technology Hardware & Equipment has the lowest sector exposure at 0.3%.
